intro: Oenanthe lachenalii subsp. silaifolia, commonly known as the Silaifolia waterdropwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Central Asia. It typically grows in moist or wet habitats such as marshes, riverbanks, and wet meadows. The plant features slender, branching stems that are often covered with fine hairs. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and have a distinctive pinnately veined structure. The flowers are small, white or greenish-white, and arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family.
